name: Photography Portfolio Website
elevator: We empower photographers to sell their professional work directly to customers through a dedicated e-commerce platform. Our platform offers secure transactions, efficient management tools, and a visually appealing dark mode design, providing a seamless experience for both photographers and buyers.
description: E-commerce platform for photographers to sell professional pictures online.

current_prd.elevator_pitch: E-commerce platform for photographers to sell professional pictures online.
current_prd.problem_statement: Photographers lack a dedicated platform to sell their work directly to customers, facing challenges in reaching a wider audience and managing transactions efficiently.
current_prd.solution: An e-commerce platform enabling photographers to showcase and sell their work, providing secure transactions and efficient management tools.

key_features.feature_description: Secure payment gateway integration for safe and reliable transactions.
User accounts with personalized dashboards for managing profiles, portfolios, and sales.
High-resolution image display with zoom and detailed descriptions.
Advanced search and filtering options to find specific types of photography.
Shopping cart and checkout process for purchasing multiple images.
Dark mode and elegant materialistic design for enhanced user experience.

steps: User navigates to the registration page
User fills in the registration form with their details
User submits the form
System validates the user's input
System creates a new user account
System sends a verification email to the user
User clicks on the verification link in the email
System verifies the user's email address
User is redirected to the login page
Photographer logs into their account
Photographer navigates to the upload page
Photographer selects the photo to upload
Photographer adds a title and description to the photo
Photographer sets the price for the photo
Photographer submits the photo
System validates the photo and its metadata
System stores the photo in the database
System updates the photographer's portfolio
Buyer navigates to the photo's page
Buyer adds the photo to their shopping cart
Buyer proceeds to checkout
Buyer enters their payment information
Buyer confirms the purchase
System processes the payment
System sends a confirmation email to the buyer
System grants the buyer a license to use the photo
System updates the photographer's sales record
Admin user navigates to the admin login page
Admin user enters their credentials
System authenticates the admin user
System redirects the admin user to the admin dashboard
Admin user navigates to the user management section
Admin user searches for a specific user
Admin user views the user's details
Admin user can update the user's information or deactivate the user's account
Admin user navigates to the sales reporting section
Admin user selects a date range
System generates a sales report for the selected date range
Admin user views the sales report, including total sales, top-selling photos, and revenue per photographer
Buyer initiates a purchase
System redirects the buyer to the payment gateway
Buyer enters their payment information
Payment gateway processes the payment
Payment gateway notifies the system of the payment status
System updates the order status and sends confirmation emails
An error occurs in the system
System logs the error details, including timestamp, error message, and affected user
System sends an alert to the technical operations team
Developer commits code changes to the repository
Continuous integration system builds and tests the code
Continuous deployment system deploys the code to the production environment
System monitors the deployment process and sends notifications
User visits the website
Analytics system tracks the user's activity, including page views, time on site, and bounce rate
Analytics system generates reports on website traffic and user behavior

current_prd.success_metrics: Number of registered photographers, number of images sold, website traffic, customer satisfaction ratings, transaction volume.
current_prd.competitors: Etsy, Shutterstock, Getty Images, Adobe Stock
current_prd.vision: To become the leading online marketplace for professional photography, connecting photographers with customers worldwide.

target_audience.name: Professional Picture Buyers
target_audience.pain_points: Finding unique and professional photos quickly
target_audience.needs_and_goals: High-quality images for commercial and personal use

phasing.rationale: This phase focuses on showcasing the core visual elements and browsing capabilities of the platform. It's demo-able because it allows stakeholders to experience the dark mode design, high-resolution image display, and search functionality without requiring full e-commerce capabilities.

This phase adds the fundamental user account and shopping cart functionalities, enabling basic e-commerce transactions. It's launch-able as it allows users to create accounts, browse images, add them to a cart, and proceed to checkout, setting the stage for payment processing.

This phase integrates secure payment processing, completing the core e-commerce functionality. It's launch-able because it enables real transactions, allowing photographers to sell their work and customers to purchase images securely.

user_personas.name: David
user_personas.goals: Find unique images for client projects

user_personas.name: Emily
user_personas.pain_points: Wants limited edition prints, desires secure payment

steps.description: Uses the search bar to find 'business meeting' images.
Selects an image and views its details.
Shows image details, price, and licensing options.
Adds the image to the shopping cart.
Confirms the image is added to the cart.

user_journeys.context: Sarah needs an image for a social media campaign.

current_prd.navigation_design: Main navigation bar at the top: Home, Categories, About Us, Contact. Footer with links to legal information and social media. Prominent search bar.
current_prd.schema:
erDiagram
  User {
    INT id
    VARCHAR name
    VARCHAR email
    VARCHAR password
    TIMESTAMP created_at
  }
  Photo {
    INT id
    INT user_id
    VARCHAR title
    TEXT description
    VARCHAR image_url
    FLOAT price
    TIMESTAMP uploaded_at
    INT license_id
  }
  Order {
    INT id
    INT user_id
    FLOAT total_amount
    TIMESTAMP created_at
  }
  OrderItem {
    INT id
    INT order_id
    INT photo_id
    INT quantity
    FLOAT price
  }
  License {
    INT id
    VARCHAR name
    TEXT description
  }
  Photo ||--o{ OrderItem : contains
  Order ||--o{ OrderItem : includes
  User ||--o{ Photo : uploads
  User ||--o{ Order : places
  Photo }o--|| License : applies_to

user_stories.title: Upload and Manage Photos

user_story.i_want: to upload and manage my photos with pricing and licensing options
user_story.so_that: I can sell my work through the platform.

acceptance_criteria: Given I am a photographer, when I upload a photo, then I can set a price for it.
Given I am a photographer, when I upload a photo, then I can add a description and tags.
Given I am a photographer, when I upload a photo, then I can specify the license type (e.g., commercial, personal).
Given I am a photographer, when I upload a photo, then I can see a preview of how it will look on the website.

user_stories.title: Browse and Purchase Photos

user_story.i_want: to browse and purchase high-quality photography
user_story.so_that: I can use them for my personal or commercial projects.

acceptance_criteria: Given I am a customer, when I browse the website, then I see photos displayed in a visually appealing dark mode design.
Given I am a customer, when I click on a photo, then I see a larger preview and details like description, price, and license.
Given I am a customer, when I add a photo to my cart, then I can proceed to checkout.
Given I am a customer, when I complete a purchase, then I receive a download link for the photo.

user_stories.title: Discover and Explore Photos

user_story.i_want: to discover and explore a wide range of professional photos
user_story.so_that: I can find the perfect image for my needs.

acceptance_criteria: Given I am a website visitor, when I land on the homepage, then I see featured photos and categories.
Given I am a website visitor, when I use the search bar, then I can find photos based on keywords or tags.
Given I am a website visitor, when I view a photographer's profile, then I see their portfolio and bio.
Given I am a website visitor, when I create an account, then I can save my favorite photos and track my purchases.

user_stories.title: Administer the Platform

user_story.so_that: I can ensure quality, manage users, and track performance.

acceptance_criteria: Given I am an admin, when I log in to the admin panel, then I can manage users, photos, and transactions.
Given I am an admin, when I review a photo upload, then I can approve or reject it based on quality and licensing.
Given I am an admin, when I view sales reports, then I can track revenue and identify popular photos.
Given I am an admin, when I manage user accounts, then I can ban or suspend users who violate the terms of service.

user_stories.title: Ensure System Stability and Security

user_story.i_want: to ensure the platform's stability, security, and performance
user_story.so_that: users have a reliable and safe experience.

acceptance_criteria: Given the system detects a payment failure, when a transaction fails, then the user is notified and the order is cancelled.
Given the system detects a high volume of traffic, when the server load increases, then the system automatically scales resources to maintain performance.
Given the system detects a security threat, when a potential vulnerability is identified, then an alert is sent to the security team.
Given the system needs maintenance, when a scheduled maintenance window occurs, then the website is put into maintenance mode with a clear message to users.

user_stories.title: Data Storage and Relationships

user_story.i_want: to define the data storage and relationships between entities
user_story.so_that: the platform can efficiently manage and retrieve data.

acceptance_criteria: Given I am a photographer, when I register on the platform, then my information is stored in the Users table.
Given I am a photographer, when I upload a photo, then the photo details are stored in the Photos table.
Given I am a photographer, when I set a price for a photo, then the price is stored in the Photos table.
Given I am a customer, when I place an order, then the order details are stored in the Orders table.
Given I am a customer, when I purchase a license for a photo, then the license details are stored in the Licenses table.

user_stories.title: Manage Photographer Portfolios

user_story.i_want: to have a portfolio to showcase my best work
user_story.so_that: potential customers can easily view my style and offerings.

acceptance_criteria: Given I am a user, when I view a photographer's profile, then I see their portfolio of uploaded photos.
Given I am a photographer, when I upload a photo, then it is automatically added to my portfolio.
Given I am a photographer, when I delete a photo, then it is removed from my portfolio.
Given I am an admin, when I view a user's profile, then I can see their portfolio.

user_stories.title: Implement Shopping Cart and Checkout

user_story.i_want: to easily add photos to a shopping cart and complete the checkout process
user_story.so_that: I can purchase multiple photos in a single transaction.

acceptance_criteria: Given I am a customer, when I add photos to my cart, then the total price is calculated correctly.
Given I am a customer, when I proceed to checkout, then I can choose from available payment methods.
Given I am a customer, when I complete the payment, then I receive an order confirmation.
Given I am a customer, when a payment fails, then I receive an error message and can retry.

user_stories.title: Enhance Search and Filtering

user_story.i_want: to easily find the photos I need using advanced search and filtering options
user_story.so_that: I can quickly locate the perfect image for my project.

acceptance_criteria: Given I am a photographer, when I upload a photo, then I can specify keywords or tags.
Given I am a customer, when I use the search bar, then I can find photos based on keywords or tags.
Given I am a customer, when I browse categories, then I see relevant photos.
Given I am a customer, when I filter search results, then I can narrow down the photos based on specific criteria (e.g., price, license type).

current_prd.tam_description: Total Addressable Market for online photography sales.
current_prd.tam_estimation_basis: Total global market for photography, including stock photos, licensed images, and prints.
current_prd.sam_description: Serviceable Available Market for professional photography e-commerce platforms.
current_prd.sam_estimation_basis: Total spending on stock photos and licensed images globally.
current_prd.som_description: Serviceable Obtainable Market within the professional photography e-commerce market.
current_prd.som_estimation_basis: Estimated market share based on platform adoption and marketing efforts.
current_prd.som_source: Internal estimates based on market penetration
current_prd.advantage_summary: Dedicated platform for photographers to sell directly to customers, offering secure transactions and efficient management tools.

validations: validates :name, presence: true, length: { maximum: 255 }, uniqueness: { scope: :organization_id }
planned.model_content:
class License < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :organization
  has_many :photos, dependent: :destroy

  validates :name, presence: true, length: { maximum: 255 }, uniqueness: { scope: :organization_id }
  validates :description, length: { maximum: 1000 }

  rhino_owner :organization
  rhino_references [:organization]
end
planned.migration_content:
class CreateLicenses < ActiveRecord::Migration[7.2]
  def change
    create_table :licenses do |t|
      t.string :name, null: false, limit: 255
      t.text :description, limit: 1000
      t.references :organization, null: false, foreign_key: true

      t.timestamps
    end
    add_index :licenses, [:name, :organization_id], unique: true
  end
end
planned.rails_model_generation_command_line: rails generate model License name:string description:text organization:references

planned.model_content:
class Photo < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :user
  belongs_to :license
  has_one_attached :image
  has_many :order_items, dependent: :destroy

  validates :title, presence: true, length: { maximum: 255 }
  validates :price, presence: true, numericality: { greater_than_or_equal_to: 0 }
  validates :description, length: { maximum: 2000 }
  validates :image, presence: true

  rhino_owner :user
  rhino_references [:user, :license]
end
planned.migration_content:
class CreatePhotos < ActiveRecord::Migration[7.2]
  def change
    create_table :photos do |t|
      t.string :title, null: false, limit: 255
      t.text :description, limit: 2000
      t.float :price, null: false
      t.references :user, null: false, foreign_key: true
      t.references :license, null: false, foreign_key: true

      t.timestamps
    end
  end
end
planned.rails_model_generation_command_line: rails generate model Photo title:string description:text price:float user:references license:references

planned.model_content:
class Order < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :user
  has_many :order_items, dependent: :destroy

  validates :total_amount, presence: true, numericality: { greater_than_or_equal_to: 0 }

  rhino_owner :user
  rhino_references [:user]
end
planned.migration_content:
class CreateOrders < ActiveRecord::Migration[7.2]
  def change
    create_table :orders do |t|
      t.float :total_amount, null: false
      t.references :user, null: false, foreign_key: true

      t.timestamps
    end
  end
end
planned.rails_model_generation_command_line: rails generate model Order total_amount:float user:references

validations: validates :quantity, presence: true, numericality: { only_integer: true, greater_than: 0 }
planned.model_content:
class OrderItem < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :order
  belongs_to :photo

  validates :quantity, presence: true, numericality: { only_integer: true, greater_than: 0 }
  validates :price, presence: true, numericality: { greater_than_or_equal_to: 0 }

  rhino_owner :order
  rhino_references [:order, :photo]
end
planned.migration_content:
class CreateOrderItems < ActiveRecord::Migration[7.2]
  def change
    create_table :order_items do |t|
      t.integer :quantity, null: false
      t.float :price, null: false
      t.references :order, null: false, foreign_key: true
      t.references :photo, null: false, foreign_key: true

      t.timestamps
    end
  end
end
planned.rails_model_generation_command_line: rails generate model OrderItem quantity:integer price:float order:references photo:references
